intro: Nassauvia macracantha var. pungens, commonly known as the prickly nassauvia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, showy flowers. The plant features spiny leaves and produces clusters of pink to red flowers that bloom in the summer. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, making it a hardy plant suitable for xeriscaping. Its botanical features make it an attractive and low-maintenance addition to arid landscapes.
